sect1.title: Quick installation
sect1.para: The basic installation is very simple:

listitem.para: To use some of the most important features of CMView you need to have PyMol installed. We recommend to get a sponsor version. However, a free version (0.99) can be downloaded from here or compiled from source.
Download the current version of CMView from downloads.
Unzip the archive into a new directory, this is where CMView will be installed.
Edit the cmview.cfg file to set the path to your pymol executable in the PYMOL_EXECUTABLE line. Note that you need to use forward slashes (even on Windows) for the path and no quotes. For example:
You are done! To run the program:
In Unix: run the cmview shell script
In Windows: double click on cmview.bat
In Mac: double click on CMView.jar

sect2.title: External libraries
sect2.para: The CMView application itself is just a single java archive file (jar file): CMView.jar. It uses a number of external libraries which for convenience we include in the downloadable zip file. These are:

listitem.para: From Apache commons: commons-codec-1.3.jar, ws-commons-util-1.0.1.jar, xmlrpc-client-3.0.jar, xmlrpc-common-3.0.jar
From the JUNG project: collections-generic-4.01.jar, jung-api-2.0-alpha2.jar, jung-graph-impl-2.0-alpha2.jar

sect2.para: All of the jar dependencies must be placed in a jars directory under the directory where CMView.jar is located.

We set the JVM memory to 256MB as the contact map generation requires quite a lot of memory. For very big protein chains (>400 aminoacids) using the ALL atom model you may need even more: set it to 512MB to be on the safe side.

sect2.title: Secondary Structure and DSSP
sect2.para: By default CMView will get the secondary structure annotation from the PDB file if present. For getting a more consistent secondary structure annotation and to have it in those cases when it is missing in the file, CMView can use the external program DSSP to assign secondary structure. You need to obtain your own licensed copy of DSSP. A free version for non-commercial use can be found here. sect2.title: Config file
sect2.para: There are other configurable parameters that can be set in the config file. Please refer to the user's manual for a full description.

The configuration file will be read first from the directory where you installed CMView (system-wide config). Per-user customisation is also possible by using a cmview.cfg file placed in your home directory (in Windows that would be something like c:\Documents and Settings\yourusername). Settings in the user configuration file will take precedence over those in the system-wide one.
